Container.Name: TModLoader
Container.Overview:
Easily and quickly set up a configurable Terraria tModLoader server that automatically downloads mods using Steam Workshop IDs.
.
Features
-Easy download of tModLoader mods from Steam Workshop
-Scheduled world saving
-Graceful shutdowns
-Optional server config for precise setting control
-GitHub automation to stay up-to-date with tModLoader's release cycle

Config.Name: World Files
Config.Description: Container Path: /home/terraria/.local/share/Terraria/tModLoader/Worlds

Config.Name: Workshop Mods
Config.Description: Container Path: /home/terraria/terraria-server/workshop-mods

Config.Name: Config File
Config.Description: Container Path: /home/terraria/terraria-server/serverconfig.txt

Config.Name: Shutdown Message
Config.Description: The message which will be sent to the in-game chat upon container shutdown.

Config.Name: Autosave Interval
Config.Description: The autosave interval (in minutes) in which the World will be saved.

Config.Name: Auto Download Mod List
Config.Description: A Comma Separated list of Workshop Mod IDs to download from Steam upon container startup. More information on Mod Workshop IDs can be found on the Github README.

Config.Name: Enabled Mods
Config.Description: A Comma Separated list of Workshop Mod IDs to enable on the tModLoader server upon startup. More information on Mod Workshop IDs can be found on the Github README.

Config.Name: MOTD
Config.Description: The Message of the Day which prints in the chat upon joining the server.

Config.Name: Server Passworrd
Config.Description: The password players must supply to join the server. Set this variable to N/A to disable.

Config.Name: Max Players
Config.Description: The maximum number of players which can join the server at once.

Config.Name: World Name
Config.Description: The name of the world file. This is seen in-game as well as will be used for the name of the .WLD file.

Config.Name: World Size
Config.Description: When generating a new world, this variable will be used to designate the size. 1 = Small, 2 = Medium, 3 = Large

Config.Name: World Seed
Config.Description: The seed for a new world.

Config.Name: Use Config File
Config.Description: If you wish to use a config file to specify MOTD, Password, Max Players, World Name, World Size, World Seed, and a few other additional settings, set this to Yes

Config.Name: Server Port
Config.Description: The port the server will run on. Terraria's default is 7777.

Config.Name: Difficulty
Config.Description: When generating a new world (and only when generating a new world), this variable will set the difficulty of the world. 1 = Normal, 2 = Master, 3 = Journey.

Config.Name: Secure Mode
Config.Description: Adds additional cheat protection. 0 = off, 1 = on

Config.Name: Language
Config.Description: Sets the language for the server. Available options are: en-US (English), de-DE (German), it-IT (Italian), fr-FR (French), es-ES (Spanish), ru-RU (Russian), zh-Hans (Chinese), pt-BR (Portuguese), pl-PL (Polish).

Config.Name: NPC Stream
Config.Description: Reduces enemy skipping, but increases bandwidth usage. The lower the number, the less skipping will happeb, but more data is sent. 0 is off.

Config.Name: Show Update Banner
Config.Description: Show update notices [true/false].
